text.0: Join glaucoma experts Mona Kaleem and Harry Quigley of Wilmer Eye Institute, Johns Hopkins Medicine, for Diagnosis Glaucoma, a podcast for people with glaucoma or anyone simply interested in learning more about the eye condition. https://t.co/SoUaNy0sq7
text.1: Congratulations to @HopkinsOrtho physician assistant, Carey Roesler. Carey was recently elected to serve on the @NCCPAcert Board for a four-year term beginning on January 1, 2021. To read more about her appointment and the NCCPA, visit: https://t.co/u4FMXYPUlH
text.2: We’re monitoring and assessing information about the COVID-19 vaccine and what it means for our patients and our communities. Here’s what we know. https://t.co/jlgjS0BsR5
text.3: Does #COVID19 cause blood clots? Is it safe to donate blood? Can mosquitoes spread the coronavirus that causes COVID-19? Two experts discuss blood and the coronavirus. https://t.co/BZ2NhzCtn4
text.4: Congratulations to my colleague Dr @SethShayMartin on his @NEJM editorial!  I am honored to be a team member of the Advanced Lipid Clinic that Dr Martin leads as the Director of Lipids at @HopkinsMedicine @hopkinsheart .  Well deserved applause for Seth :clapping_hands::clapping_hands::clapping_hands: :party_popper::party_popper::party_popper: https://t.co/VHMGqTwLwi
text.5: Here’s a scene from one of our final classes from @hopkinsmedicine this semester on effective teaching in a clinical setting. Great insights from educators across medicine. I’ll miss this virtual community we created! @JH_TSP @MLRobertsonMD @r_rlevine https://t.co/WBtJMHZj0N
text.6: Although #psoriaticarthritis afflicts men and women in equal numbers; the two genders are not equally affected. @jhrheumatology
text.7: Front-line worker at The Johns Hopkins Hospital honored as a @Ravens Hometown Hero. Hear his story here: https://t.co/CQdtaG989M
